result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel A Peace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).
  • Repeated 1st Deg. Sex.Assault-Same Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to sentence in case 05CF1125, consecutive to count two.

superMiscConds.notes: Participate in vocational training while in the institution.

No contact with the victims or any witnesses in the trial.
Do not maintain or use any social media accounts.  Defendant may have access to email accounts and electronic devices, which must be made available to agent for inspection upon demand.

Restitution set at zero.
Register and comply with the sex offender registry.
Comply with all rules as set forth by agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Obtain/comply with sex offender treatment.
Report make, model and license plate of vehicle to agent.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession, voting.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to sentence in case 05CF1125, consecutive to count one.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-12-2014 at 08:30 am.

Jury panel polled.  Jury panel excused and out of the box at 2:04 p.m.
State moves for judgment on the verdict on each count.  Defense moves for dismissal on each count notwithstanding the verdicts.  Court grants State's motion and orders judgments of conviction be entered on the record on both counts.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 25.  No PSI.
Clerk:  jms

Jury in the box at 2:00 p.m.
The jury returned and by their foreperson returned verdicts as follows:
"We, the jury, find defendant, Daniel Peace, guilty of Sexual Assault of a Child Under 13 Years of Age (C.C.) as charged in Count # 1 of the Information."
"We, the jury, find defendant, Daniel Peace, guilty of Repeated Sexual Assault of a Child (S.R.) as charged in Count # 2 of the Information."  both "Dated this 30th day of July, 2014" and signed by the foreperson.

Defendant Daniel A Peace in court with attorney Gary E. Rosenthal.  Defendant Daniel A Peace in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Exhibit # 1 marked for identification, offered and received.
Jury in the box at 10:11 a.m.
Court reads the stipulation to the jury panel  (Exhibit# 1)
Sworn and testified for the State:  Amanda Didier, Forensic Interviewer, Children's Hospital of Wisconsin.
State rests subject to rebuttal.
Jury out of the box at 10:37 a.m.
Defense motion for dismissal denied by the Court.
Court holds colloquy with defendant and finds that defendant knowingly, intelligently and willingly waives his right to testify.
Court reviews jury instructions with the parties.
Jury in the box at 11:09 a.m.
Defense rests.  Evidence is now closed.  Court instructs the jury.  Closing arguments by the State and defense counsel.  Court charges the jury.  Alternate juror chosen.
At the hour of 12:20 p.m. the jury retired to deliberate under the charge of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept. Deputies P. Terrell and J. Gaidosh, who were duly sworn for that purpose.
Clerk:  jms

Case recalled.  Same appearances.
Jury in the box at 1:12 p.m.
Testimony continues with Lisa S. who was re-sworn.
Sworn and testified for the State:  S.R.
Jury out of the box at 2:11 p.m.  Jury in the box at 2:20 p.m.
Sworn and testified for the State:  Lashawanda P-C,  Kelly H.,   and K.H.

Court orders case adjourned for the evening.  Case is adjourned to 07-30-2014.
Jury panel is excused for the evening.  Jury out of the box at 3:20 p.m.
